alert.note: Alert for Clay; Knox; Laurel (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 5:17PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Laurel, northwestern Knox and central Clay Counties through 545 PM EST... At 516 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lesbas, or 7 miles southeast of London, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cane Creek, Lida, Gibbs, Knoxfork and Deer Lick around 520 PM EST. Sasser, Lake, Bush, Blackwater, Marydell, Tedders, Sprule and Fletcher around 525 PM EST. Pigeonroost, Cottongin, Jonsee, Park Valley, Herron, Hooker, Woollum, Urban and Haven around 530 PM EST. Manchester, Bluehole, House, Hima, Horse Creek Junction, Sibert, Littleton and Ogle around 535 PM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Boho, Goose Rock, Botto, Plank, Lipps, Brightshade, Hector, Spurlock and Barcreek. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 4 and 31. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 35 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
